section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

A carrier shall provide a reasonable alternative standard, or a waiver of the otherwise applicable standard, for obtaining the incentive for any individual for whom it is:
unreasonably difficult due to a medical condition to satisfy the otherwise applicable standard; or
medically inadvisable to attempt to satisfy the otherwise applicable standard.

A carrier may seek verification, such as a statement from an individual's health care provider, that a health factor makes it unreasonably difficult or medically inadvisable for the individual to satisfy or attempt to satisfy the otherwise applicable standard.
A carrier shall disclose the availability of a reasonable alternative standard or a waiver of the otherwise applicable standard in all policy forms pertaining to the bona fide wellness program.
A carrier may meet the disclosure requirements of this paragraph by using the following language or substantially similar language:

In determining if a carrier's bona fide wellness program meets the requirements of this section, the Commissioner may request a review of the bona fide wellness program by an independent review organization from the list compiled under § 15-10A-05(b) of this title.
The expense of the review of the bona fide wellness program by an independent review organization shall be paid by the carrier, in the manner provided under § 15-10A-05(h) of this title.
